column4: hello again everyone. I've just swapped my mainboard and processor out and rebooted and the PC has come up with most stuff working fine.. except for my x.org/nvidia AGP card.. is there some way I can make it auto detect and resetup every thing again?

hello again everyone. I've just swapped my mainboard and processor out and rebooted and the PC has come up with most stuff working fine.. except for my x.org/nvidia AGP card.. is there some way I can make it auto detect and resetup every thing again?
hmm so why is it crashing when I kick in GDM
do you want the xserver output? (last few lines anyhow)?
ahh crap.. I know what I've done wrong :-P I haven't attached the extrnal power to it.. sorry for wasting your time :-P
ok gdm starts A-okay now, then when I log in I get a brown screen with a mouse pointer.. thats it.. No icons I got no "loading splash" or anything..
have you something like gnome installed
something like? I have a full Ubuntu install no real customisations other than non-free drivers like the nvidia
that is to say... the normal ubuntu desktop which is Gnome
and wait for it to load ^^
It's been waiting for about 5 mins now... still nothing and no disc activity
